situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The chihuahua has 78 dollars. The chihuahua was born three and a half years ago. The finch has a card that is red in color, is named Casper, and is a nurse. The seahorse has 48 dollars. The shark borrows one of the weapons of the german shepherd. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: The chihuahua will call the elk if it (the chihuahua) has more money than the seahorse. Rule2: Regarding the finch, if it has a card with a primary color, then we can conclude that it invests in the company whose owner is the elk. Rule3: The finch will not invest in the company whose owner is the elk if it (the finch) has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the dinosaur's name. Rule4: Regarding the chihuahua, if it is less than 13 months old, then we can conclude that it calls the elk. Rule5: If you are positive that you saw one of the animals hugs the seahorse, you can be certain that it will also build a power plant near the green fields of the llama. Rule6: Regarding the finch, if it works in computer science and engineering, then we can conclude that it invests in the company whose owner is the elk. Rule7: In order to conclude that elk does not build a power plant close to the green fields of the llama, two pieces of evidence are required: firstly the finch invests in the company whose owner is the elk and secondly the chihuahua calls the elk. Rule3 is preferred over Rule2. Rule3 is preferred over Rule6. Rule5 is preferred over Rule7.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the elk build a power plant near the green fields of the llama?
label: disproved
